alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 20 at 4:07PM EDT until March 23 at 3:13AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson, Washington and Johnson Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Oconee...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Oconee. * WHEN...From Monday morning to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16 feet, Bankfull conditions are reached along the river. The Old Balls Ferry Road boat ramp...just upstream and right bank from the Georgia Highway 57 bridge...will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 16.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 17.8 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.8 feet on 12/26/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
